SEARCH
Package edu.ser216.checkers.core

Interface CheckersGame

All Known Implementing Classes:
CheckersGameLogic
public interface CheckersGame
An interface that abstractly defines a checkers game board with logic.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    doTurn()
    Indicates to the game that a players turn should occur (i.e., read a move and act upon it).
    char
    getSquare(int row, int column)
    Returns the square at a specific location on the game board.
    char
    getWinningPlayer()
    Returns 'x' if player X has won, 'o' if player O has won, and '_' otherwise.
    void
    nextTurn()
    Indicates to the game that it is the next player's turn.
    void
    onEnd()
    Indicates to the game that it is over.
    void
    setSquare(int row, int column, char content)
    Sets the contents ('x', 'o', or '_') of the game board.

  • Method Details

    • getSquare

      char getSquare(int row, int column)
      Returns the square at a specific location on the game board. For example, given the following board: 8|_|o|_|o|_|o|_|o| 7|o|_|o|_|o|_|o|_| 6|_|o|_|o|_|o|_|o| 5|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_| 4|_|_|_|_|_|_|_|_| 3|x|_|x|_|x|_|x|_| 2|_|x|_|x|_|x|_|x| 1|x|_|x|_|x|_|x|_| a b c d e f g h getSquare(0,0) would return 'x'.
      Parameters:
      row - Row.
      column - Column.
      Returns:
      Contents of game board at position.

    • setSquare

      void setSquare(int row, int column, char content)
      Sets the contents ('x', 'o', or '_') of the game board.
      Parameters:
      row - Row.
      column - Column.
      content - Contents.

    • getWinningPlayer

      char getWinningPlayer()
      Returns 'x' if player X has won, 'o' if player O has won, and '_' otherwise. May be called at any time.
      Returns:
      A character representing the winter.

    • nextTurn

      void nextTurn()
      Indicates to the game that it is the next player's turn. To read input from the keyboard, this method must make use of the Scanner object passed into the constructor of this CheckersGame. Valid inputs must look like "3a-4b".

    • doTurn

      void doTurn()
      Indicates to the game that a players turn should occur (i.e., read a move and act upon it).

    • onEnd

      void onEnd()
      Indicates to the game that it is over. Used to do things like display the winner.
